page.title: 05Services
page.content: There are few services in the area no shops,pubs, schools,bus or train services. Children from the region attend Brightwalton Primary School and at the age of 11 transfer to the Downs Comprehensive School at Compton some 6 miles to the east. The county council provide a coach as transport to the 2 schools. The post office as part of its service runs a mini-bus which can be taken to Newbury but this is quite irregular and depends on deliveries and collections. Doctors surgeries are at Chieveley about 5 miles distant. There is a surgery mini-bus for those without transport.The vet. for the area is at West Ilsley.Most households have some form of transport.Essential services include water,electricity, septic tank drainage.A public callbox is by the Church.A mobile shop selling many things calls at the village.
